lines.content: > ‚ÄúBy failing to prepare, you are preparing to fail.‚Äù ‚Äì Benjamin Franklin, Founding Father of the United States
Bored of having traditional to-do lists? Looking for something fun to boost your productivity?
The all-in-one Kirby Deluxe Bot provides an unorthodox way of keeping track of your tasks by simulating a chat bot!
- Kirby features a **clean and sleek interface** with **convenient** and simple command inputs.
- Encompassing a range of features from **chronological sort** to **search functionalities**, it can boost your productivity by leaps and bounds.
- Owing to its name persona, Kirby adopts a **highly emotive response** feedback as it connects with its users with a personal touch! üíõ
Interactive and Simple-to-Use Task Bot Application
Check out the [User Guide](https://sltsheryl.github.io/ip/#quick-start) for instructions on how to download Kirby.

Bored of the traditional to-do task list applications?

Kirby is a desktop task management app that provides a refreshing way of keeping track of your ongoing tasks! While incorporating the interactive element offered by chat bots, it improvises the conventional features of a task manager. Through its intuitive interface and input system, Kirby provides unparalleled convenience to its users and is easy to learn.
1. Ensure you have Java `11` or above installed in your Computer.
3. Open a command window in that folder.
4. Run the command `java -jar kirby.jar` (i.e., run the command in the same folder as the jar file).
Create one of the three types of task supported by Kirby.
| Todo  | A simple to-do task with no time frame can be added.| `todo <task name>`|
| Event | A special occasion happening at a time.  | `event <task name> /at <time>`|
| Deadline |A task with a designated time frame to be completed.  | `deadline <task name> /by <time>`|
For tasks with a `` component, users can input valid date format `yyyy-mm-dd` and the tasks would be ordered in a chronological order.
The `<task name>` and `<time>` are required fields if they are shown in the command syntax above.
Delete an existing task in the list of tasks using the index position.
If a task is completed, mark it so that it is shown as marked in the list of tasks when `show` is called.
Marked tasks are represented with checkboxes
If a task is incomplete, unmark it so that it is shown as pending in the list of tasks when `show` is called.
Display the list of all tasks that are currently in the list.
### Find Tasks Corresponding to a Keyword: `find <keyword>`
List down all the tasks that contain a specified keyword.
### Get Tasks Occurring on a Date: `get <yyyy-mm-dd>`
List down all the tasks that happened on a specified date.
View all the commands with proper command syntax.
Exit the program once you have finished using Kirby.
Your existing tasks would be stored locally and saved when you open Kirby again.
| **Add Event** | `event <task name> /at <time>`  | `event CS2100 exam /at 2022-09-13`, `event d1NNer dAt3 /at 5pm`|
| **Add Deadline** | `deadline <task name> /by <time>`  | `Finish marking duty /by 2022-12-01`, `deadline st2334 assignment /by tomorrow`|
**Q:** Will my existing tasks be saved after I close the program?
**A:** Rest assured, your tasks will be stored and you can view them again using `show` once you open Kirby again.
**Q:** How do I transfer my data to another Computer?

**A:** Install the app in the other computer and overwrite the empty data file `kirby.txt` it creates with the file that contains the data of your previous Kirby folder (default would be `kirby.txt`).
**Q:** What if I added a task that has an invalid date format for ``?
**A:** The `` field need not be in the form of a date. If it is not in a standard form `yyyy-mm-dd`, it will be saved as a raw input.
If it is in the `yyyy-mm-dd` format, it will then be displayed in the Date - Month - Year syntax.
